Posted By: chinkeeyong (11/5/2010 12:43:06 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Oh Snap!  
I love that card. Then again, who does not love bouncing for free (regarding mana of course, not card advantage), and possibly even generating an additional mana or two?  
In some cases even worth using on your own creatures to trigger certain cip/etb effects once more, as with [Cloud Faeries](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cloud Faeries) if you have a land which produces more than one mana when tapped, or to [rescue](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=rescue) one of your creatures which is being targeted by removal.  
And i also think it's better than [Unsummon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unsummon) in general - nobody urgently wants to bounce a creature in the first turn anyways (except for threats like a [Goblin Lackey](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Lackey)), and not being able to cast Snap when drawing it since you've only one open mana left won't happen that often either.  
  
Oh, and you know this won't work nammertime since [Isochron Scepter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Isochron Scepter) won't untap from untapping lands, right?^^
posts.html:
Oh Snap!
I love that card. Then again, who does not love bouncing for free (regarding mana of course, not card advantage), and possibly even generating an additional mana or two?
In some cases even worth using on your own creatures to trigger certain cip/etb effects once more, as with Cloud Faeries if you have a land which produces more than one mana when tapped, or to rescue one of your creatures which is being targeted by removal.
And i also think it's better than Unsummon in general - nobody urgently wants to bounce a creature in the first turn anyways (except for threats like a Goblin Lackey), and not being able to cast Snap when drawing it since you've only one open mana left won't happen that often either.

Oh, and you know this won't work nammertime since Isochron Scepter won't untap from untapping lands, right?^^

posts.post_content:
Unsummon is a 1 drop tho. If you got 5 mana and want to get a 4 drop out, if you have unsummon you can hold it and bounce at the end of their turn. Its not about needing it on turn 1.  
  
Other then that, this card is pretty dang strong in comparison.
